name: Railsbank GBP Business Scenarios
description: A set of standard business scenarios which can be automatically tested using the runner to regression test before each update.

folders.name: Create, credit, and transfer virtual currency between virtual ledgers
Enduser Compliance
folders.description: Creates an enduser that breaks a set firewall rule. Resolves the enduser's case in quarantine.

folders.name: Interledger Transfer GBP
folders.description: Creates an enduser, creates a ledger for that enduser, transfers money to that ledger from the company ledger.

folders.name: Receiving GBP (Faster Payments)
folders.description: Will test that an outside bank account can credit a ledger

folders.name: Return GBP + Transactions Compliance
folders.description: Creates an transaction that breaks a set firewall rule. Displays that the transaction is in quarantine to prove the rules work.

requests.name: Set firewall rules (endusers)
requests.rawModeData:
{
  "compliance_firewall_rules": "
             [rules
               [rule :missing-city [let [address [get-canonical-address enduser]]
                                     [if [nil? address]
                                       missing-data
                                       [if [not-contains? address :address/city]
                                         missing-data]]]]
               [rule :country-is-GBR
                 [let [address [get-canonical-address enduser]]
                   (if [contains? address :address/country]
                     (if [contains? #{\"GBR\"} [get [get address :address/country] :country/iso3]]
                       quarantine))]]]"
                       }
requests.tests:
tests["Status code is 200"] = responseCode.code === 200;
tests["CORS is present"] = postman.getResponseHeader("access-control-allow-origin");
